column4: UPDATE 5-SEC scrutiny of Tesla grows as Goldman hints at adviser role
column5: WASHINGTON  Aug 15 The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has sent subpoenas to Tesla Inc regarding Chief Executive Elon Musk's plan to take the company private and his statement that funding was "secured " Fox Business Network reported on Wednesday  citing sources.

column4: Tesla  Musk face SEC wrist slap at worst  experts say
column5: Tesla CEO Elon Musk and the company itself may have little to fear from U.S. regulators according to legal analysts  despite Musk's failure so far to back up his early August tweet saying he had "funding secured" for his plan to take the electric car maker private.

column4: COLUMN-Tesla  Musk face SEC wrist slap at worst  experts say: Frankel
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 15    Tesla CEO Elon Musk and the company itself may have little to fear from U.S. regulators according to legal analysts  despite Musk's failure so far to back up his early August tweet saying he had "funding secured" for his plan to take the electric car maker private.

column4: U.S. SEC subpoenas Tesla over Musk's tweets -Fox News
column5: Aug 15 The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has sent subpoenas to Tesla Inc regarding its privatization plans and Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk's statement "funding secured"  Fox News tweeted https://twitter.com/CGasparino/status/1029740099339268096 on Wednesday  citing sources.

column4: Musk bid for Tesla: no formal offer  no firm deals with advisers
column5: (This August 14 story was corrected to say "private" instaed of "public" in paragraph 14) | Video

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 8-Musk bid for Tesla: no formal offer  no firm deals with advisers (Aug. 14)
column5: Aug 14 Tesla Inc's board named a special committee of three directors on Tuesday to decide what to do about Chief Executive Elon Musk's potential offer to take the electric carmaker private  although Musk has yet to make a formal offer and is still negotiating to hire advisers needed to do a deal.

column4: Saudi fund may only play minor part in Musk's $72 billion Tesla plan: bankers
column5: RIYADH Elon Musk told investors this week that "obviously  the Saudi sovereign fund has more than enough capital needed" to finance taking Tesla private.

column4: Major Tesla shareholders trimmed stakes last quarter: filings
column5: NEW YORK Two major Tesla Inc shareholders cut their stakes in the electric automaker during the second quarter  before Chief Executive Elon Musk announced he would try to take the company private earlier this month.

column4: A look at Tesla's nine-member board
column5: Tesla Inc's board has named a special committee of three directors to negotiate with Chief Executive Elon Musk on taking the electric car maker private  although it said it was yet to see a firm offer from him.
